channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ray Dalio says the world is running out of interest in buying U.S. debt—but America is unable to cut back its spending
item.description: But Dalio, speaking at the Future China Global Forum in Singapore this week, doesn't think the U.S. is in a position to pull back on its spending.

item.title: Elected officials and dozens of protesters are arrested at Manhattan immigration holding facility
item.description: More than a dozen elected officials were arrested Thursday while protesting conditions at a New York City immigration holding facility where a federal...

item.title: Abolish the FCC
item.description: Rather than fantasizing about using government power to punish the left, Republicans should foreclose the possibility of future suppression.

item.title: Patients Win with Free Speech for Pharmaceutical Ads
item.description: Patients should be free to choose what products they want, but also be free to learn about them.

item.title: The great AI commerce startup opportunity, according to Andreessen Horowitz
item.description: A16Z's Alex Rampell and Justine Moore go deep on the ramifications of rapidly changing consumer behavior.

item.title: Conservatives hoot as leftists launch Disney boycott for yanking Jimmy Kimmel
item.description: After years of aggravating the right with its woke content and policies, Disney has now officially enraged the left.

item.title: Chuck Schumer questions whether Epstein was 'the real reason' Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show was canceled
item.description: Sen. Chuck Schumer suggested that Jimmy Kimmel's comments on the Jeffrey Epstein case contributed to the abrupt cancellation of his late-night show.

item.title: As immigration arrests spike in Chicago, activists escalate tactics to fight back

item.title: The Fed’s cut was ‘more hawkish than anticipated,’ Moody’s Zandi says — and warns it won’t be enough to stave off a looming jobs recession
item.description: The market didn’t get the dovish signal it was looking for.

item.title: Trump may use tariff revenue to bail out farmers, agriculture secretary says. They’re reeling from challenges caused by the levies to begin with

item.title: The Week: Democrats Flirt with Shutdown Politics
item.description: Plus: ABC suspends Jimmy Kimmel indefinitely.

item.title: NYC comptroller tries to force way into ICE offices as security locks down federal facility
item.description: Protesters were led by NYC Comptroller Brad Lander outside ICE offices while activists outside blocked agency vans from leaving the facility.

item.title: Gen Z college grads are flocking to Texas and Florida where companies have ‘overwhelmingly’ relocated their headquarters
item.description: These markets are becoming nearly as popular as New York and San Francisco.

item.title: Fox News Politics Newsletter: Clinton slammed for promoting book labeling opponents 'fascists'
item.description: Welcome to the Fox News Politics newsletter, with the latest updates on the Trump administration, Capitol Hill and more Fox News politics content.

item.title: The Kirk Assassination Won’t Silence Us
item.description: We need to find the courage to speak as free men.

item.title: Riefenstahl Raises the Riddle of Artistic Heroism
item.description: A timely hit job equates cinema and politics.
